title: Full Body A: Push Emphasis
focus: Learn superset pacing + moderate loads for movement quality
description: Week 1, Day 1—Welcome to time-efficient training. Today you'll learn superset technique: pair two exercises with minimal transition time (<15sec between exercises, 60-90sec rest between supersets). Loads are moderate (60-65%, RPE 6-7) to allow focus on pacing and form. Session time: 30-35min. Key goal: master the transitions without sacrificing movement quality.

quote.text: Don't rush through exercises, but move deliberately between them.
quote.author: Time-Constrained Program Philosophy

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Elevate heart rate and prepare joints for supersets (5-10min)

exercises.name: Light Cardio (Bike, Row, or Jog)

intensity.description: Until you break a light sweat

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature—don't skip this step

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Leg swings (forward/back, side-to-side), arm circles (forward/back), bodyweight squats, push-ups (5 reps)—prepare joints and movement patterns

sections.title: Superset 1
sections.overview: Goblet Squat + Push-ups (3 sets, 60-90sec rest after both exercises)

exercises.name: Goblet Squat

intensity.description: Hold dumbbell at chest, focus on depth and upright torso. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2 sec descent, 1 sec pause at bottom, explosive up
exercises.notes: Setup: Hold dumbbell vertically at chest (goblet position), feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out. Execution: Descend to parallel or below (elbows should travel inside knees), pause briefly, drive up explosively. Focus: Maintain upright torso, chest proud, full depth. Transition goal: <15sec from finishing squats to starting push-ups. Purpose: Lower body foundation, quad/glute strength, movement quality baseline.

exercises.name: Push-ups

intensity.description: Modify difficulty to hit RPE: elevate feet for harder, incline or knee push-ups for easier. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled descent to chest, explosive push
exercises.notes: Setup: Hands slightly wider than shoulders, body straight from head to heels, core engaged. Execution: Descend until chest nearly touches floor (or touches if mobile), push explosively to lockout. Modifications: Too easy? Elevate feet on bench. Too hard? Use incline (hands on bench) or knee push-ups. Focus: Maintain plank position—no sagging hips or arched back. Purpose: Upper body push strength, chest/shoulder/tricep foundation.

sections.title: Superset 2
sections.overview: Dumbbell RDL + Dumbbell Shoulder Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)

intensity.description: Hinge pattern with focus on hamstring stretch. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent (feel hamstring stretch), controlled return
exercises.notes: Setup: Hold dumbbells at sides, feet hip-width, knees slightly bent. Execution: Hinge at hips (push hips back, not down), feel hamstring stretch as dumbbells travel to mid-shin, squeeze glutes to return. Don't round lower back—maintain neutral spine. Focus: Eccentric stretch (feel hamstrings working), hip hinge pattern (not a squat). Transition goal: <15sec to shoulder press. Purpose: Posterior chain foundation (hamstrings/glutes), hip hinge technique.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press

intensity.description: Standing or seated, focus on full lockout overhead. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Standing (core engagement) or seated (easier balance). Hold dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward. Execution: Press dumbbells overhead to full lockout (don't hyperextend back), control descent to shoulder level. Focus: Lockout fully but maintain core stability, don't arch back excessively. Purpose: Shoulder strength foundation, overhead pressing pattern.

sections.title: Superset 3
sections.overview: Dumbbell Row + Plank (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Dumbbell Row (Single-Arm)

intensity.description: Pull to hip, squeeze shoulder blade back. 10 reps per arm. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled pull, squeeze at top, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: One hand and knee on bench for support, opposite arm holds dumbbell. Execution: Pull dumbbell to hip (not to chest—pull straight back), squeeze shoulder blade back at top, control descent. Don't rotate torso—keep shoulders square. Focus: Lat and mid-back contraction, scapular retraction. Purpose: Back thickness, unilateral pulling strength. Note: Do 10 reps right arm, then 10 reps left arm = 1 set.

exercises.name: Plank (Forearms)

intensity.description: Maintain straight body position. If hips sag before 30sec, end set.

exercises.notes: Setup: Forearms on ground, elbows under shoulders, body straight from head to heels. Execution: Engage core and glutes—don't let hips sag or pike up. Breathe normally (don't hold breath). Focus: Full-body tension, neutral spine. If form breaks (hips sag), end set immediately. Purpose: Core stability, anti-extension strength. Progression: If 45sec is easy next week, add weight to back (plate or weighted vest).

sections.title: Optional Cardio Finisher
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy after main work (5min)

exercises.name: Row Intervals

intensity.description: Total 8 rounds = 8min. Skip if you're pressed for time or fatigued.

exercises.notes: 20sec hard effort (RPE 8—breathing hard but controlled), 40sec easy recovery (RPE 4—light spin). Repeat 8 times. Purpose: Cardiovascular conditioning, work capacity. Optional: Only do if you have 5min left and feel energized. The main supersets are the priority.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Light stretching to aid recovery (5min)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Focus areas: quads (front of thigh), hamstrings (back of thigh), chest (doorway stretch), shoulders (cross-body and overhead). Hold each stretch 20-30sec, breathe deeply. Purpose: Aid recovery, reduce muscle tension.

title: Full Body B: Pull Emphasis
description: Week 1, Day 3—Pull emphasis today. You'll introduce barbell deadlift (lighter than you'd normally pull, focus on bar speed and form) and pull-ups or lat pulldowns. Continue practicing superset pacing: <15sec transitions, 60-90sec rest between supersets. Compare your transition times to Day 1—are you getting more efficient? Session time: 30-35min.

quote.text: If you're gasping for air or form breaks down significantly, you're moving too fast—extend rest and dial back intensity.
quote.author: Time-Constrained Program Philosophy

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Same as Day 1—light cardio + dynamic stretching (5-10min)

exercises.name: Light Cardio (Bike, Row, or Jog)

intensity.description: Until you break a light sweat

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Leg swings, arm circles, bodyweight squats, light RDL pattern with empty bar or stick (practice hinge for deadlifts), scapular pull-ups or dead hangs (if doing pull-ups later)

sections.title: Superset 1
sections.overview: Barbell Deadlift + Pull-ups or Lat Pulldown (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift (Conventional or Sumo)

intensity.description: This is lighter than you'd normally deadlift—focus on bar speed and perfect form. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled setup, explosive pull, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Bar over mid-foot, feet hip-width (conventional) or wider with toes out (sumo). Grip just outside legs. Chest up, lats engaged (pull bar into shins before lift), hips higher than knees. Execution: Big breath, brace core, push floor away with legs (don't pull with back), bar scrapes shins/thighs, lockout with glutes (don't hyperextend back). Lower with control. Focus: Perfect setup every rep—don't rush. Bar speed should be fast off floor. Transition goal: <15sec to pull-ups. Purpose: Full-body strength, posterior chain emphasis, barbell technique foundation.

exercises.name: Pull-ups OR Lat Pulldown

intensity.description: Pull-ups: If you can do 6+ clean reps, use bodyweight. If not, use assisted machine or lat pulldown. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled pull, squeeze lats at bottom, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Pull-ups: Hang from bar, hands slightly wider than shoulders (pronated grip—palms away). Pull elbows down (not back), bring chin over bar, squeeze lats at top, control descent to full hang. If you can't do 6 clean reps, use assisted pull-up machine or lat pulldown instead. Lat Pulldown: Sit with thighs secured, grab bar slightly wider than shoulders. Pull bar to upper chest (lean back slightly), squeeze lats, control return. Focus: Lat engagement (feel mid-back working), full ROM. Purpose: Back width, vertical pulling strength.

sections.title: Superset 2
sections.overview: Goblet Squat + Dumbbell Bench Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Goblet Squat

intensity.description: Same as Day 1—may use slightly heavier dumbbell if Day 1 felt too easy (RPE 6). Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2 sec descent, 1 sec pause, explosive up
exercises.notes: Same setup and execution as Day 1. Hold dumbbell vertically at chest, descend to parallel or below, drive up explosively. Focus: Depth and upright torso. If Day 1 you used a 30lb dumbbell and it felt RPE 6 (very easy), try 35lb or 40lb today to hit RPE 6-7. Purpose: Lower body strength, movement consistency across sessions.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press

intensity.description: Lie on flat bench, press dumbbells up and slightly together. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent to chest level
exercises.notes: Setup: Lie on flat bench, feet on floor, dumbbells held at chest level (just outside chest width). Execution: Press dumbbells up and slightly together at top (don't bang them together), lower with control to chest level (elbows ~45-degree angle to torso). Don't bounce at bottom. Focus: Full ROM, stable shoulder position. Purpose: Chest/shoulder/tricep strength, horizontal pressing pattern.

sections.title: Superset 3
sections.overview: Dumbbell RDL + Dumbbell Curls (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)

intensity.description: Same as Day 1. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent (feel hamstring stretch), controlled return
exercises.notes: Same setup and execution as Day 1. Hinge at hips, push hips back, feel hamstring stretch as dumbbells travel to mid-shin, squeeze glutes to return. Maintain neutral spine. Focus: Hamstring stretch and glute contraction. Purpose: Posterior chain strength, movement consistency.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Curls (Standing)

intensity.description: Strict form—no swinging or body English. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled curl, squeeze biceps at top, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms forward (supinated grip). Execution: Curl dumbbells to shoulder height (don't swing or use momentum), squeeze biceps at top, control descent to full elbow extension. Keep elbows pinned to sides—don't let them drift forward. Focus: Bicep contraction, strict form. No body English—if you need to swing the weight up, it's too heavy. Purpose: Bicep strength, elbow flexion pattern.

sections.title: Optional Cardio Finisher
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy (5min)

exercises.name: Jump Rope

intensity.value: Moderate pace (focus on rhythm, not max speed)
intensity.description: Total 7.5min. Skip if fatigued or pressed for time.

exercises.notes: 1min jump rope at moderate pace (focus on rhythm and consistency—not max speed), 30sec rest. Repeat 5 times. If you don't have a jump rope or can't jump (joint issues), substitute with high knees in place or step-ups. Purpose: Cardiovascular conditioning, coordination. Optional: Only do if you have 5min left and feel energized.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Light stretching (5min)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Focus areas: quads, hamstrings, glutes, chest, lats (overhead and side stretches), biceps. Hold each stretch 20-30sec. Breathe deeply. Purpose: Aid recovery, reduce muscle tension.

title: Full Body C: Lower Emphasis
description: Week 1, Day 5—Lower emphasis today. You'll perform front squat or goblet squat, barbell RDL (heavier load than dumbbell RDL due to barbell), and walking lunges (unilateral leg work). This completes Week 1: you've trained each major movement pattern (squat, hinge, push, pull) 3 times this week. Reflect on pacing improvements and load appropriateness. Session time: 30-35min.

quote.text: Training doesn't have to consume your life. Consistency over perfection.
quote.author: Time-Constrained Program Philosophy

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Same as Day 1 and Day 3 (5-10min)

exercises.name: Light Cardio (Bike, Row, or Jog)

intensity.description: Until you break a light sweat

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Leg swings, hip circles, ankle mobility (wall drives), bodyweight squats, walking lunges (10 steps—practice for Superset 3), light RDL pattern with empty bar

sections.title: Superset 1
sections.overview: Front Squat or Goblet Squat + Dumbbell Bench Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Front Squat OR Goblet Squat

intensity.description: Front squat if comfortable with barbell, otherwise goblet squat. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent, brief pause, explosive up
exercises.notes: Front Squat: Bar rests on front delts (clean grip—elbows high—or cross-arm grip). Feet shoulder-width, toes slightly out. Descend to parallel or below (stay upright—don't let torso collapse forward), drive up explosively. Goblet Squat: Same as Day 1 and Day 3. Choose based on comfort level—if you're new to barbell work, stick with goblet; if you want to progress, try front squat with empty bar or light weight. Focus: Depth, upright torso, quad engagement. Transition goal: <15sec to bench press. Purpose: Quad-dominant squat pattern, lower body strength.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press

intensity.description: Same as Day 3. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent to chest level
exercises.notes: Same setup and execution as Day 3. Lie on flat bench, press dumbbells up and slightly together, control descent to chest level. Don't bounce at bottom. Focus: Full ROM, stable shoulder position. Purpose: Chest/shoulder/tricep strength, movement consistency.

sections.title: Superset 2
sections.overview: Barbell RDL + Dumbbell Row (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)

intensity.description: Same hinge pattern as dumbbell RDL but with barbell (allows heavier load). Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent (feel hamstring stretch), explosive glute contraction to return
exercises.notes: Setup: Barbell starts in deadlift position (on floor) or on rack at hip height. Feet hip-width, overhand grip just outside legs. Execution: Hinge at hips (push hips back), bar travels down shins to mid-shin (feel hamstring stretch), squeeze glutes to return to standing. Knees stay slightly bent throughout. Don't round lower back—maintain neutral spine. Focus: Hamstring eccentric stretch, glute contraction at top. Barbell allows heavier load than dumbbells—if you used 40lb dumbbells for dumbbell RDL, you might use 95-115lbs on barbell RDL. Purpose: Posterior chain strength, hip hinge pattern with heavier loads.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Row (Both Arms, Bent-Over Position)

intensity.description: Bent-over position (no bench support). Row dumbbells to hips, squeeze shoulder blades together. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled pull, squeeze at top, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Hinge at hips (similar to RDL position but holding dumbbells). Torso ~45-degree angle to floor, knees slightly bent. Execution: Row dumbbells to hips (pull elbows back, not out to sides), squeeze shoulder blades together at top, control descent. Don't let torso rotate—keep shoulders square. Focus: Mid-back and lat contraction. This variation (both arms simultaneously, bent-over) is more challenging than single-arm supported row from Day 1/Day 3—requires core stability. Purpose: Back thickness, bilateral pulling strength.

sections.title: Superset 3
sections.overview: Walking Lunges + Dumbbell Overhead Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Walking Lunges

intensity.description: Hold dumbbells at sides, lunge forward continuously. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled descent, explosive drive through front heel to next step
exercises.notes: Setup: Hold dumbbells at sides (not overhead—that's too advanced for Week 1). Stand upright. Execution: Step forward into lunge (front thigh parallel to ground, back knee nearly touches floor), push through front heel to step forward into next lunge (don't step back—walk forward continuously). 10 steps per leg = 20 total steps per set. You'll need ~20-30 feet of space (gym floor, hallway, parking lot). Focus: Front knee tracks over toes (don't cave inward), torso upright, balance and control. If you wobble significantly, use lighter dumbbells or bodyweight only. Purpose: Unilateral leg strength, quad/glute emphasis, balance and stability.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Overhead Press

intensity.description: Same as Day 1. Standing or seated. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Same setup and execution as Day 1. Standing (core engagement) or seated (easier balance). Press dumbbells overhead to full lockout, control descent to shoulder level. Don't hyperextend back. Focus: Lockout and shoulder stability. Purpose: Shoulder strength, overhead pressing pattern, movement consistency.

sections.title: Optional Cardio Finisher
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy (5min)

exercises.name: Hill Sprints (or Incline Treadmill Sprints)
exercises.duration: 10-15 sec sprint, walk back down for recovery

intensity.description: Total ~5min. Skip if fatigued or pressed for time.

exercises.notes: Find a hill (outdoor) or set treadmill to 8-10% incline. Sprint hard uphill for 10-15sec (RPE 9—nearly max effort), walk back down for recovery (or walk on treadmill at 0% for 45-60sec). Repeat 6 times. Purpose: Anaerobic conditioning, power development. Optional: Only do if you have energy left after main work. If not, skip—Week 1 is about building the habit and learning pacing, not conditioning yourself to exhaustion.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Extra focus on legs after lower-emphasis session (5min)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Focus areas: quads (standing quad stretch or couch stretch), hamstrings (standing or seated), glutes (figure-4 stretch or pigeon pose), calves, hip flexors, shoulders. Hold each stretch 20-30sec. Breathe deeply. You'll likely be sore in legs tomorrow (DOMS from lunges and squats)—light stretching now can help. Purpose: Aid recovery, reduce muscle tension.

title: Full Body A: Push Emphasis
focus: Progressive overload — add weight or reps from Week 3
description: Week 4, Day 1—Progressive Overload Mid-Phase. Loads have increased to 70-75% (RPE 7-8). Your warm-up should feel routine by now. This week, compare to Week 3: if you completed all reps at RPE 7-8, add 5-10lbs to compounds or 1-2 reps to accessories. Track every set. Session time: 35-40min (extended from Week 1's 30-35min due to heavier loads requiring longer rest).

quote.text: Progressive overload in action—are you lifting 5-10lbs heavier or doing 1-2 more reps per set? That's progress.
quote.author: Time-Constrained Week 4 Philosophy

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Should feel routine by now—don't skip it (5-10min)

exercises.name: Light Cardio (Bike, Row, or Jog)

intensity.description: Until you break a light sweat

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature—by Week 4 this should be automatic

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Leg swings, hip circles, ankle mobility, bodyweight squats (focus on depth), light bar work (empty bar squats and RDLs to practice patterns)—prepare for barbell work

sections.title: Superset 1
sections.overview: Barbell Back Squat + Push-ups (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat

intensity.description: 70-75% estimated 1RM. If Week 3 you squatted 135lbs×10 @ RPE 7, try 145lbs×10 or 135lbs×12. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent, drive explosively up
exercises.notes: Setup: Bar on traps (high-bar) or rear delts (low-bar), feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out. Execution: Descend to parallel or below (2-3sec controlled descent), drive up explosively through heels. Focus: Maintain upright torso, bar path straight up/down, no dive-bombing. Progressive overload: If Week 3 felt RPE 7 (easy), add 5-10lbs today. If RPE 8 (appropriate), maintain weight and aim for 1-2 more reps. Transition goal: <15sec to push-ups. Purpose: Lower body strength, quad/glute development, barbell competency.

exercises.name: Push-ups (Weighted or Elevated if needed)

intensity.description: If bodyweight push-ups are too easy (20+ reps possible), add weight via backpack with plates or elevate feet on bench. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled descent to chest, explosive push
exercises.notes: Setup: Hands slightly wider than shoulders, body straight from head to heels, core engaged. Execution: Descend until chest nearly touches floor, push explosively to lockout. Modifications: Too easy? Add weight (backpack with 10-25lbs plates) or elevate feet on bench. Too hard? Use incline (hands on bench). Progressive overload: If Week 3 you did 12 bodyweight reps @ RPE 7, try weighted push-ups (10-15lbs backpack) or aim for 15 reps bodyweight. Focus: Maintain plank position throughout—no sagging hips. Purpose: Upper body push strength, chest/shoulder/tricep development.

sections.title: Superset 2
sections.overview: Barbell Deadlift + Dumbbell Shoulder Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift (Conventional or Sumo)

intensity.description: 70-75% estimated 1RM. If Week 3 you pulled 185lbs×8 @ RPE 7, try 205lbs×8 or 185lbs×10. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled setup, explosive pull, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Bar over mid-foot, feet hip-width (conventional) or wider with toes out (sumo). Perfect setup every rep: chest up, lats engaged (pull bar into shins), hips higher than knees. Execution: Big breath, brace core, push floor away with legs (don't pull with back), bar scrapes shins/thighs, lockout with glutes. Lower with control. Focus: Bar speed should be fast off floor—if it's grinding on rep 6, you're at your limit. Progressive overload: If Week 3 felt RPE 7, add 10-20lbs (deadlift responds well to larger jumps). If RPE 8, add 5-10lbs or aim for 2 more reps. Transition goal: <15sec to shoulder press. Purpose: Full-body strength, posterior chain emphasis, work capacity.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press (Standing or Seated)

intensity.description: Standing (harder, more core engagement) or seated (easier balance). If Week 3 you used 30lb dumbbells×10, try 35lb×10 or 30lb×12. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press overhead, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Standing (core engagement) or seated (easier if fatigued). Dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward. Execution: Press dumbbells overhead to full lockout (don't hyperextend back), control descent to shoulder level. Focus: Lockout fully but maintain core stability, don't arch back excessively. Progressive overload: Dumbbells increase in 5lb increments (each side), so if Week 3 you pressed 30lb dumbbells, next jump is 35lb. If that's too big a jump, aim for 2 more reps with 30lb. Purpose: Shoulder strength, overhead pressing pattern.

sections.title: Superset 3
sections.overview: Chest-Supported Row or Dumbbell Row + Plank (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Chest-Supported Row OR Dumbbell Row (Single-Arm)

intensity.description: If you have access to chest-supported row machine, use it (eliminates lower back fatigue). Otherwise dumbbell rows work great. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled pull, squeeze at top, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Chest-Supported Row: Lie prone on incline bench or use chest-supported row machine. Pull handles/dumbbells to sides, squeeze shoulder blades back at top. Eliminates lower back fatigue—allows you to focus purely on back. Dumbbell Row (if no chest-support available): One hand and knee on bench, opposite arm rows dumbbell to hip. Pull straight back (not to chest), squeeze shoulder blade, control descent. Progressive overload: If Week 3 felt RPE 7, add 5lbs per dumbbell (or 10lbs on machine). If RPE 8, aim for 2 more reps per arm. Purpose: Back thickness, horizontal pulling strength, unilateral work (addresses imbalances if using dumbbells).

exercises.name: Plank (Forearms)

intensity.description: Increased duration from Week 1 (30-45sec). If hips sag before 45sec, end set. If 60sec is easy, add weight to back (plate).

exercises.notes: Setup: Forearms on ground, elbows under shoulders, body straight from head to heels. Execution: Engage core and glutes—don't let hips sag or pike up. Breathe normally (don't hold breath). Focus: Full-body tension, neutral spine. If form breaks (hips sag), end set immediately. Progressive overload: Week 1 you held 30-45sec. This week aim for 45-60sec. If 60sec is easy with perfect form, add a 10-25lb plate to your back. Purpose: Core stability, anti-extension strength, transfer to all lifts.

sections.title: Optional 4th Superset (Advanced Trainees)
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy—session should stay under 45min (2 sets)

exercises.name: Goblet Squat

intensity.description: Additional quad volume if time/energy allows. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2 sec descent, 1 sec pause, explosive up
exercises.notes: Same setup as Week 1 goblet squats. Hold heavy dumbbell vertically at chest, descend to parallel or below, drive up explosively. Purpose: Additional quad volume (if you feel like you can handle more work after 3 supersets). Only add if session time stays under 45min total. This is optional—main 3 supersets are the priority.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Chest Flyes

intensity.description: Additional chest volume (isolation). Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled descent (feel chest stretch), controlled squeeze to top
exercises.notes: Setup: Lie on flat bench, dumbbells held above chest with slight elbow bend (like hugging a barrel). Execution: Lower dumbbells out to sides in arc motion (feel deep chest stretch), squeeze back to top position. Keep slight elbow bend throughout—don't straighten arms (becomes a press). Purpose: Chest isolation, stretch-focused work. Optional—only add if you have time and energy after main 3 supersets.

sections.title: Optional Cardio Finisher
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy after main work (8min)

exercises.name: Assault Bike Intervals

intensity.description: Total 10 rounds = 10min. Skip if fatigued or pressed for time—main supersets are priority.

exercises.notes: 15sec all-out sprint (RPE 9—nearly max effort, arms and legs driving hard), 45sec easy recovery (RPE 4—light spin). Repeat 10 times. If you don't have assault bike, substitute with: row machine, bike, or running (same interval structure). Purpose: Anaerobic conditioning, work capacity. Optional: Only do if you have energy left and time allows. If you're fatigued from work/life stress this week, skip the finisher—the main 3 supersets are what matter.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Light stretching to aid recovery (5min)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Focus areas: quads (front of thigh), hamstrings (back of thigh), hip flexors, chest (doorway stretch), shoulders (cross-body and overhead), lats (overhead side stretch). Hold each stretch 20-30sec, breathe deeply. By Week 4, recovery is more important—don't skip cooldown. Purpose: Aid recovery, reduce muscle tension, improve flexibility.

title: Full Body B: Pull Emphasis
focus: Second deadlift session + vertical pulling strength
description: Week 4, Day 3—Pull emphasis. You're deadlifting again today (second time this week)—this builds work capacity without excessive volume per session. Loads may be slightly lighter than Tuesday due to accumulated fatigue, and that's fine. Focus on bar speed and perfect form. Continue progressive overload: compare to Week 3 Day 3. Session time: 35-40min.

quote.text: Deadlifts twice per week builds work capacity without excessive volume per session.
quote.author: Time-Constrained Programming Philosophy

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Same as Tuesday—light cardio + dynamic stretching (5-10min)

exercises.name: Light Cardio (Bike, Row, or Jog)

intensity.description: Until you break a light sweat

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Leg swings, hip circles, cat-cow (back mobility for deadlifts), scapular pull-ups or dead hangs (if doing pull-ups later), light bar work (empty bar deadlifts to groove pattern)

sections.title: Superset 1
sections.overview: Barbell Deadlift + Pull-ups or Lat Pulldown (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift (Conventional or Sumo)

intensity.description: Second deadlift session this week. Loads may be slightly lighter than Tuesday due to fatigue—that's expected. Focus on bar speed and form. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled setup, explosive pull, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Same as Tuesday—bar over mid-foot, perfect setup every rep. Execution: Push floor away with legs, bar speed fast off floor, lockout with glutes. Focus: This is your second deadlift session in 3 days (Tue + Thu). You're building work capacity and posterior chain strength without excessive volume per session (3 sets each day = 6 sets/week total, distributed). Loads: If Tuesday you pulled 205lbs×8, today you might pull 195-205lbs depending on fatigue. That's fine—don't chase Tuesday's numbers if you're fatigued. Bar speed is king: if bar moves fast, load is appropriate. If grinding on rep 6, reduce 10lbs. Purpose: Work capacity, posterior chain strength, deadlift frequency builds technique competency.

exercises.name: Pull-ups OR Lat Pulldown

intensity.description: If Week 3 you did 8 bodyweight pull-ups, try adding 5-10lbs via weight belt or aim for 10 reps. If using lat pulldown and you did 100lbs×10, try 110lbs×10 or 100lbs×12. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled pull, squeeze lats at bottom, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Pull-ups: Hang from bar, hands slightly wider than shoulders (pronated grip—palms away). Pull elbows down (not back), bring chin over bar, squeeze lats at top, control descent to full hang. Progressive overload: If Week 3 you did 8 bodyweight reps, try adding weight (5-10lbs via weight belt or dip belt) and aiming for 6-8 reps, OR aim for 10 bodyweight reps. Lat Pulldown (if can't do 6+ pull-ups): Sit with thighs secured, grab bar slightly wider than shoulders. Pull bar to upper chest (lean back slightly), squeeze lats, control return. Progressive overload: Add 5-10lbs to machine or 1-2 reps. Focus: Lat engagement (feel mid-back working), full ROM. Purpose: Back width, vertical pulling strength.

sections.title: Superset 2
sections.overview: Goblet Squat or Front Squat + Dumbbell Bench Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Goblet Squat OR Front Squat

intensity.description: Goblet: If Week 3 you used 50lb dumbbell×12, try 55lb×12 or 50lb×15. Front squat: If you've progressed to barbell, add 5-10lbs or 1-2 reps. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent, brief pause, explosive up
exercises.notes: Goblet Squat: Hold dumbbell vertically at chest, descend to parallel or below, drive up explosively. Progressive overload: Dumbbells typically jump in 5lb increments, so if Week 3 you used 50lb, try 55lb. If that's too big a jump, aim for more reps (50lb×15 instead of ×12). Front Squat (if progressing to barbell): Bar on front delts, elbows high, chest up. Same progression logic: add 5-10lbs or 1-2 reps from Week 3. Choose based on comfort: If you're still building confidence with barbell, stick with goblet. If you want to progress, try front squat with light barbell. Purpose: Quad-dominant squat pattern, lower body strength.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press

intensity.description: If Week 3 you used 50lb dumbbells×10, try 55lb×10 or 50lb×12. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent to chest level
exercises.notes: Setup: Lie on flat bench, feet on floor, dumbbells held at chest level. Execution: Press dumbbells up and slightly together at top (don't bang them), lower with control to chest level (elbows ~45-degree angle). Don't bounce at bottom. Progressive overload: Dumbbells jump in 5lb increments (each side). If Week 3 you pressed 50lb dumbbells, try 55lb today. If that's too hard (would hit failure before rep 8), stick with 50lb and aim for 2 more reps. Focus: Full ROM, stable shoulder position, controlled eccentric. Purpose: Chest/shoulder/tricep strength, horizontal pressing pattern.

sections.title: Superset 3
sections.overview: Dumbbell RDL + Dumbbell Curls (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)

intensity.description: Progressive overload applies to accessories too. Add 2.5-5lbs per dumbbell if Week 3 felt easy. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent (feel hamstring stretch), controlled return
exercises.notes: Setup: Hold dumbbells at sides, feet hip-width, knees slightly bent. Execution: Hinge at hips (push hips back), feel hamstring stretch as dumbbells travel to mid-shin, squeeze glutes to return. Maintain neutral spine—don't round lower back. Progressive overload: If Week 3 you used 40lb dumbbells×12, try 45lb×12 or 40lb×15. Accessories respond well to volume—adding 2 reps is as effective as adding weight. Focus: Hamstring eccentric stretch, glute contraction at top. Purpose: Posterior chain strength, hip hinge pattern.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Curls (Standing)

intensity.description: Strict form—no swinging. Add 2.5-5lbs per dumbbell if Week 3 felt easy. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled curl, squeeze biceps at top, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms forward (supinated grip). Execution: Curl dumbbells to shoulder height (don't swing or use momentum), squeeze biceps at top, control descent to full elbow extension. Keep elbows pinned to sides—don't let them drift forward. Progressive overload: If Week 3 you used 25lb dumbbells×12, try 30lb×12 or 25lb×15. Curls respond well to volume—if weight jump feels too big, add reps instead. Focus: Bicep contraction, strict form. No body English—if you need to swing, weight is too heavy. Purpose: Bicep strength, elbow flexion pattern.

sections.title: Optional Cardio Finisher
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy (6min)

exercises.name: Burpees

intensity.description: Total ~6min. Skip if fatigued or pressed for time—main supersets are priority.

exercises.notes: 10 burpees (chest to ground, jump to stand with hands overhead), rest 30sec. Repeat 5 times. Purpose: Full-body conditioning, metabolic conditioning. Optional: Only do if you have energy left after main work. If you're feeling run-down or sleep-deprived this week, skip the finisher—the main 3 supersets are what matter most.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Light stretching (5min)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Focus areas: hamstrings (standing or seated), glutes (figure-4 stretch), lower back (cat-cow or child's pose), lats (overhead and side stretches), biceps. Hold each stretch 20-30sec. Breathe deeply. You've deadlifted twice this week (Tue + Thu)—lower back and hamstrings need recovery attention. Purpose: Aid recovery, reduce muscle tension.

title: Full Body C: Lower Emphasis
focus: Final progressive overload session of the week—finish strong
description: Week 4, Day 5—Lower emphasis. This completes Week 4: you've trained Tue/Thu/Sat with heavier loads than Week 3. Front squat or barbell back squat (variation from Tuesday), barbell RDL (heavier loads possible vs dumbbells), walking lunges with progressive overload. Compare Week 4 totals to Week 3: are you lifting 5-10% more across the board? Session time: 35-40min.

quote.text: Compare Week 4 totals to Week 3 totals—are you lifting 5-10% more across the board? That's the goal.
quote.author: Progressive Overload Philosophy

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Same routine (5-10min)

exercises.name: Light Cardio (Bike, Row, or Jog)

intensity.description: Until you break a light sweat

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Leg swings, hip circles, ankle mobility (wall drives), bodyweight squats, walking lunges (10 steps—practice for Superset 3), light bar work (empty bar squats and RDLs)

sections.title: Superset 1
sections.overview: Front Squat or Barbell Back Squat + Dumbbell Bench Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Front Squat OR Barbell Back Squat

intensity.description: If Tuesday you did back squat, consider front squat here for variation. If you've been doing goblet, try barbell front squat. Add 5-10lbs or 1-2 reps from Week 3. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent, brief pause, explosive up
exercises.notes: Front Squat: Bar rests on front delts (clean grip—elbows high—or cross-arm grip). Feet shoulder-width, toes slightly out. Descend to parallel or below (stay upright—don't let torso collapse forward), drive up explosively. Barbell Back Squat (if choosing this): Same setup as Tuesday. Consider variation: if Tuesday was high-bar (bar on traps), try low-bar (bar on rear delts) today, or vice versa. Progressive overload: If Week 3 you front squatted 95lbs×10, try 105lbs×10 or 95lbs×12. If transitioning from goblet to barbell, start conservative (empty bar or 65lbs) to learn pattern. Focus: Depth, upright torso, quad engagement. Purpose: Quad-dominant squat pattern, lower body strength, barbell variation.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press

intensity.description: Third bench press session this week (Tue, Thu, Sat). Loads may be slightly lighter due to fatigue—that's expected. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Same setup and execution as Thursday. Press dumbbells up and slightly together, control descent to chest level. Focus: This is your third bench press session in 5 days. Chest volume is accumulating—you may feel slightly fatigued, and that's normal. Don't chase Thursday's numbers if you're tired—focus on quality reps and hitting RPE 7-8. Progressive overload: Compare to Week 3 Day 5 (not Thursday Day 3). If Week 3 you pressed 50lb dumbbells×10, try 55lb×10 or 50lb×12 today. Purpose: Chest/shoulder/tricep strength, volume accumulation across 3 sessions.

sections.title: Superset 2
sections.overview: Barbell RDL + Dumbbell Row or Barbell Row (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)

intensity.description: Barbell allows heavier loads than dumbbells. If Week 3 you did 95lbs×12, try 115lbs×12 or 95lbs×15. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent (feel hamstring stretch), explosive glute contraction to return
exercises.notes: Setup: Barbell starts in deadlift position (on floor) or on rack at hip height. Feet hip-width, overhand grip just outside legs. Execution: Hinge at hips (push hips back), bar travels down shins to mid-shin (feel hamstring stretch), squeeze glutes to return to standing. Knees stay slightly bent throughout. Don't round lower back—maintain neutral spine. Focus: Hamstring eccentric stretch (this is where the growth happens), glute contraction at top (lockout with glutes, not back). Progressive overload: Barbell RDL allows heavier loads than dumbbell RDL. If Thursday you used 40lb dumbbells (80lbs total), today you might use 115-135lbs on barbell (heavier because bilateral). Add 10-20lbs from Week 3 or 2-3 more reps. Purpose: Posterior chain strength, hip hinge pattern with heavier loads.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Row (Bent-Over, Both Arms) OR Barbell Row

intensity.description: Bent-over dumbbell rows (both arms simultaneously, no bench support) or barbell rows. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled pull, squeeze at top, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Dumbbell Row (bent-over position, both arms): Hinge at hips (similar to RDL position but holding dumbbells). Torso ~45-degree angle to floor, knees slightly bent. Row dumbbells to hips (pull elbows back, not out to sides), squeeze shoulder blades together at top, control descent. Don't let torso rotate—keep shoulders square. This variation (both arms, bent-over, no bench support) is harder than Tuesday's single-arm supported row—requires core stability. Barbell Row (alternative): Same bent-over position. Pull barbell to sternum (underhand or overhand grip), squeeze shoulder blades. Progressive overload: Add 5lbs per dumbbell or 10lbs to barbell from Week 3, or add 1-2 reps. Focus: Mid-back and lat contraction. Purpose: Back thickness, bilateral pulling strength, core stability.

sections.title: Superset 3
sections.overview: Walking Lunges + Dumbbell Overhead Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Walking Lunges

intensity.description: Hold heavier dumbbells than Week 3. If you used 20lb dumbbells, try 25lb or 30lb. Lunge pattern should be controlled. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled descent, explosive drive through front heel to next step
exercises.notes: Setup: Hold dumbbells at sides (not overhead). Stand upright. Execution: Step forward into lunge (front thigh parallel to ground, back knee nearly touches floor), push through front heel to step forward into next lunge (don't step back—walk forward continuously). 10-12 steps per leg = 20-24 total steps per set. You'll need ~20-30 feet of space. Progressive overload: If Week 3 you used 20lb dumbbells×10/leg, try 25lb×10/leg or 20lb×12/leg today. Dumbbells jump in 5lb increments—if 25lb feels too heavy, add reps with 20lb instead. Focus: Front knee tracks over toes (don't cave inward), torso upright, balance and control. If you wobble significantly, use lighter weight—form is priority. Purpose: Unilateral leg strength, quad/glute emphasis, balance and stability.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Overhead Press

intensity.description: Third overhead press session this week (Tue, Thu, Sat). Standing or seated. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Same setup and execution as Tuesday and Thursday. Press dumbbells overhead to full lockout, control descent to shoulder level. Don't hyperextend back. Focus: This is your third overhead press session in 5 days. Shoulders are accumulating volume—you may feel slightly fatigued. That's normal and expected. Don't chase Tuesday's numbers if you're tired—hit RPE 7-8 with good form. Progressive overload: Compare to Week 3 Day 5 (not Thursday). If Week 3 you pressed 30lb dumbbells×10, try 35lb×10 or 30lb×12 today. Purpose: Shoulder strength, overhead pressing pattern, volume accumulation.

sections.title: Optional Cardio Finisher
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy (8min)

exercises.name: Farmer Carries

intensity.value: Heavy dumbbells or kettlebells—challenging to hold but you can walk without stopping
intensity.description: Total ~8min. Skip if fatigued—main supersets are priority.

exercises.notes: Pick weight that's challenging to hold (e.g., 60-80lb dumbbells or kettlebells per hand if strong, 40-50lb if less experienced). Walk 40-50 yards with good posture (chest up, shoulders back, core tight), set weights down, rest 90sec. Repeat 4 times. Purpose: Grip strength, core stability, full-body strength endurance. Optional: Only do if you have time and energy. If you're fatigued from 3 progressive overload sessions this week, skip it—the main work is done.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Extra focus on legs after lower-emphasis session (5min)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Focus areas: quads (standing quad stretch or couch stretch), hamstrings (standing or seated), glutes (figure-4 or pigeon pose), hip flexors (kneeling lunge stretch), calves, shoulders. Hold each stretch 20-30sec. Breathe deeply. Week 4 is complete after this session—you've accumulated significant training stress (heavier loads than Week 1-2, 3 sessions with short rest periods). Stretching now aids recovery. Purpose: Aid recovery, reduce muscle tension, improve flexibility. Week 4 reflection: Compare loads to Week 3—did you successfully add 5-10lbs or 1-2 reps across most exercises? That's progressive overload in action.

title: Full Body A: Push Emphasis
focus: Final push before Week 7 peak test—finish strong
description: Week 6, Day 1—Final week of Progressive Overload before Week 7's peak test. Loads remain 70-75% (RPE 7-8), but by now you should be handling significantly more weight than Week 3. This week, aim for upper end of rep ranges (try to hit 10 reps if range is 8-10) or slightly heavier loads. Week 8 is a scheduled deload, so don't worry about pushing hard—you'll get recovery. Session time: 35-40min.

quote.text: Week 6 is about finishing strong—make every rep count, maintain perfect form, and track everything.
quote.author: Progressive Overload Final Week Philosophy

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Should be efficient and thorough by Week 6—don't skimp (5-10min)

exercises.name: Light Cardio (Bike, Row, or Jog)

intensity.description: Until you break a light sweat

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature—by Week 6 this should feel automatic. You're about to lift heavier than Week 5, so don't skimp on warm-up.

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Leg swings (forward/back, side-to-side), arm circles (forward/back), bodyweight squats (focus on depth and upright torso), light bar work (empty bar squats, presses, RDLs)—prepare for heavy barbell work. By Week 6, warm-up efficiency matters—know what you need.

sections.title: Superset 1
sections.overview: Barbell Back Squat + Push-ups (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat

intensity.description: 70-75% estimated 1RM. If Week 5 you squatted 155lbs×10 @ RPE 7-8, try 165lbs×10 or 155lbs×12. Aim for upper end of rep range. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent, drive explosively up
exercises.notes: Setup: Bar on traps (high-bar) or rear delts (low-bar), feet shoulder-width, toes slightly out. Execution: Descend to parallel or below (2-3sec controlled), drive up explosively through heels. Focus: Bar speed on ascent—if rep 10 is a grind, you're at your limit; if rep 10 feels like you have 2-3 more in the tank, perfect RPE 7-8. This is your final progressive overload squat session before Week 7's heavier test (75-80% @ RPE 8-9). Make it count: if you've been hitting 8 reps comfortably, push for 10 this week. If you've been hitting 10 reps, add 5-10lbs and aim for 8-10. Track loads—you'll compare these to Week 7. Transition goal: <15sec to push-ups. Purpose: Lower body strength, quad/glute development, peak progressive overload before test week.

exercises.name: Push-ups (Weighted or Elevated)

intensity.description: Weighted if needed to hit RPE. If bodyweight is still challenging, aim for 15 clean reps per set this week (upper end of range). Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled descent to chest, explosive push
exercises.notes: Setup: Hands slightly wider than shoulders, body straight from head to heels, core engaged. Execution: Descend until chest nearly touches floor, push explosively to lockout. Week 6 progression: If you've been doing bodyweight push-ups and hitting 12 reps comfortably, push for 15 this week. If 15 bodyweight feels easy (RPE 6), add weight (backpack with 15-25lbs) and aim for 12-15 reps @ RPE 7-8. If you've been doing weighted push-ups, add 5lbs to backpack or increase reps. Focus: Maintain plank position throughout—no sagging hips. This is the final progressive overload push-up session before Week 7 (which may use barbell bench press for heavier loads). Purpose: Upper body push strength, chest/shoulder/tricep development, bodyweight strength capacity.

sections.title: Superset 2
sections.overview: Barbell Deadlift + Dumbbell Shoulder Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift (Conventional or Sumo)

intensity.description: 70-75% estimated 1RM. If Week 5 you pulled 225lbs×8 @ RPE 7-8, try 235lbs×8 or 225lbs×10. Final progressive overload session before Week 7's heavier test. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled setup, explosive pull, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Bar over mid-foot, feet hip-width (conventional) or wider with toes out (sumo). Perfect setup every rep: chest up, lats engaged (pull bar into shins), hips higher than knees. Execution: Big breath, brace core, push floor away with legs (don't pull with back), bar scrapes shins/thighs, lockout with glutes. Lower with control. Focus: This is your final progressive overload deadlift session before Week 7's heavier test—make it count. Bar speed should be fast off floor. If Week 5 you hit 8 reps comfortably, push for 10 reps this week OR add 10lbs and maintain 8 reps. Track bar speed: if first rep feels fast, load is appropriate; if it's grinding from rep 1, reduce 5-10lbs. Week 7 you'll test 75-80% loads (RPE 8-9), so Week 6 should feel manageable but challenging. Transition goal: <15sec to shoulder press. Purpose: Full-body strength, posterior chain emphasis, peak progressive overload before test.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press (Standing or Seated)

intensity.description: If Week 5 you pressed 40lb dumbbells×10, try 45lb×10 or 40lb×12. Standing preferred. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press overhead, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Standing (core engagement, harder) or seated (easier if fatigued). Dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward. Execution: Press dumbbells overhead to full lockout (don't hyperextend back), control descent to shoulder level. Focus: Week 6 progression—if you've been using 40lb dumbbells and hitting 10 reps, try 45lb dumbbells (5lb jump per side) and aim for 8-10 reps. If 45lb feels too heavy for 8 reps, stick with 40lb and push for 12 reps. Dumbbells increase in 5lb increments, so progression can be challenging—adding reps is equally valid. Lockout fully but maintain core stability, don't arch back excessively. Standing preferred for core engagement and full-body stability (translates better to other lifts). Purpose: Shoulder strength, overhead pressing pattern, upper body strength capacity.

sections.title: Superset 3
sections.overview: Chest-Supported Row or Dumbbell Row + Plank (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Chest-Supported Row OR Dumbbell Row (Single-Arm)

intensity.description: Focus on squeeze at contraction—this is back thickness work. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled pull, squeeze at top for 1-2sec, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Chest-Supported Row (preferred if available): Lie prone on incline bench or use chest-supported row machine. Pull handles/dumbbells to sides, squeeze shoulder blades back at top for 1-2sec (emphasize contraction), control descent. Eliminates lower back fatigue—allows pure back focus. Dumbbell Row (if no chest-support): One hand and knee on bench, opposite arm rows dumbbell to hip. Pull straight back (not to chest), squeeze shoulder blade for 1-2sec at top, control descent. Week 6 progression: If Week 5 you rowed 55lb dumbbells×12, try 60lb×12 or 55lb×15. Focus on squeeze at contraction this week—time under tension at peak contraction builds back thickness. Don't rush reps—1-2sec squeeze at top is key. Purpose: Back thickness (mid-back, rhomboids), horizontal pulling strength, scapular retraction strength.

exercises.name: Plank (Forearms)

intensity.description: If you can hold perfect form for 60sec, add weight to your back (10-25lb plate or weighted vest). If form breaks before 60sec, end set immediately.

exercises.notes: Setup: Forearms on ground, elbows under shoulders, body straight from head to heels. Execution: Engage core and glutes—don't let hips sag or pike up. Breathe normally (don't hold breath). Focus: Week 6 progression—you should be able to hold 60sec with perfect form by now. If you can hold 60sec easily (hips don't sag, breathing controlled), add weight: place a 10-25lb plate on your back or use a weighted vest. If you can't hold 60sec with perfect form, that's your limit—end set when hips sag. Progressive overload on plank is duration (Week 1: 30-45sec → Week 6: 60sec) or load (Week 6: add 10-25lbs). Full-body tension, neutral spine. If form breaks (hips sag, back arches), end set immediately—no value in planking with poor form. Purpose: Core stability, anti-extension strength, transfer to all lifts (bracing for squats, deadlifts).

sections.title: Optional 4th Superset (Advanced Trainees)
sections.overview: Only add if time/energy allows and session stays under 45min (2 sets)

exercises.name: Goblet Squat

intensity.description: Additional quad volume if you're feeling strong. This week is about quality over quantity—only add if energy allows.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent, 1 sec pause, explosive up
exercises.notes: Same setup as Week 1 goblet squats. Hold heavy dumbbell vertically at chest, descend to parallel or below, drive up explosively. Week 6 progression: If you've been doing this optional 4th superset in previous weeks, try heavier dumbbell or push for 15 reps. If you haven't added 4th superset yet, Week 6 is a good week to try it—your work capacity has increased significantly. Purpose: Additional quad volume (if you feel like you can handle more work after 3 main supersets). Only add if session time stays under 45min total. This is optional—main 3 supersets are the priority.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Chest Flyes

intensity.description: Additional chest volume (isolation). Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled descent (feel deep chest stretch), controlled squeeze to top
exercises.notes: Setup: Lie on flat bench, dumbbells held above chest with slight elbow bend (like hugging a barrel). Execution: Lower dumbbells out to sides in arc motion (feel deep chest stretch at bottom), squeeze back to top position (dumbbells nearly touch but don't bang). Keep slight elbow bend throughout—don't straighten arms (becomes a press). Focus on stretch at bottom and squeeze at top. Purpose: Chest isolation, stretch-focused work, additional volume. Optional—only add if you have time and energy after main 3 supersets. Week 6 is about finishing strong on main work, not adding unnecessary fatigue.

sections.title: Optional Cardio Finisher
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy after main work (10min)

exercises.name: Row Intervals

intensity.description: Total 8 rounds = 16min. Skip if fatigued—main supersets are priority.

exercises.notes: 30sec hard effort (RPE 8-9—breathing hard, legs burning), 90sec easy recovery (RPE 4—light spin to catch breath). Repeat 8 times. Purpose: Cardiovascular conditioning, work capacity. Week 6 finisher is longer (16min vs Week 1's 8min, Week 4's 8min), but still optional. If you're feeling fatigued from 6 weeks of progressive overload, skip the finisher this week—the main 3 supersets are what matters. Week 7 is peak week, Week 8 is deload—prioritize being fresh for Week 7's test over adding cardio fatigue now. Only do finisher if you have energy and want the conditioning work.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Extra stretching—prepare for Day 3 and Week 7 (5min)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Focus areas: quads (front of thigh—standing quad stretch or couch stretch), hamstrings (standing or seated), chest (doorway stretch), shoulders (cross-body and overhead), lats (overhead side stretch). Hold each stretch 20-30sec, breathe deeply. Week 6 cooldown is important—you've accumulated 6 weeks of progressive overload. You'll want to be recovered for Day 3 (Wednesday) and especially for Week 7's peak test. Don't skip cooldown this week. Purpose: Aid recovery, reduce muscle tension, improve flexibility, prepare for final push (Day 3 + Week 7).

title: Full Body B: Pull Emphasis
focus: Second deadlift session + vertical pulling strength
description: Week 6, Day 3—Pull emphasis. Second deadlift session this week (work capacity building). Loads may be slightly lighter than Monday due to accumulated fatigue—that's expected. Focus on form and bar speed. This is your final progressive overload session for RDLs and curls before Week 7's peak test. Push for max reps or slightly heavier dumbbells. Session time: 35-40min.

quote.text: Compare to Week 5 Day 3—progressive overload check. How's your pull-up strength? Back thickness from rows improving?
quote.author: Week 6 Reflection

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Same as Monday—efficient and thorough (5-10min)

exercises.name: Light Cardio (Bike, Row, or Jog)

intensity.description: Until you break a light sweat

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Leg swings, hip circles, cat-cow (back mobility for deadlifts), scapular pull-ups or dead hangs (if doing pull-ups later—10-15sec hang to activate lats), light bar work (empty bar deadlifts to groove hinge pattern, empty bar rows). Prepare for second deadlift session and heavy vertical pulling.

sections.title: Superset 1
sections.overview: Barbell Deadlift + Pull-ups or Lat Pulldown (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift (Conventional or Sumo)

intensity.description: Second deadlift session this week. Loads may be slightly lighter than Monday due to fatigue—that's expected. Focus on form and bar speed. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled setup, explosive pull, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Setup: Same as Monday—bar over mid-foot, perfect setup every rep. Execution: Push floor away with legs, bar speed fast off floor, lockout with glutes. Focus: This is your second deadlift session in 3 days (Mon + Wed). You're building work capacity and posterior chain strength without excessive volume per session (3 sets each day = 6 sets/week total, distributed). Loads: If Monday you pulled 235lbs×8, today you might pull 225-235lbs depending on accumulated fatigue. That's fine and expected—don't chase Monday's numbers if you're fatigued. Bar speed is king: if bar moves fast off floor, load is appropriate; if grinding from rep 1, reduce 10lbs. Week 6 context: This is your final progressive overload deadlift cycle before Week 7's peak test (75-80% @ RPE 8-9). Week 8 is deload, so you'll get recovery. Purpose: Work capacity, posterior chain strength, deadlift frequency builds technique competency.

exercises.name: Pull-ups OR Lat Pulldown

intensity.description: If Week 5 you did 10 bodyweight pull-ups, try adding 10lbs via weight belt and aim for 8 reps. If using lat pulldown and you did 120lbs×10, try 130lbs×10 or 120lbs×12. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled pull, squeeze lats at bottom for 1-2sec, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Pull-ups: Hang from bar, hands slightly wider than shoulders (pronated grip—palms away). Pull elbows down (not back), bring chin over bar, squeeze lats at bottom for 1-2sec (emphasize contraction), control descent to full hang. Week 6 progression: If Week 5 you did 10 bodyweight reps, try adding 10lbs via weight belt or dip belt and aiming for 8 reps. If you've been doing weighted pull-ups, add 5lbs or push for more reps. Lat Pulldown (if can't do 6+ pull-ups): Sit with thighs secured, grab bar slightly wider than shoulders. Pull bar to upper chest (lean back slightly ~15 degrees), squeeze lats at bottom for 1-2sec, control return. Week 6 progression: If you did 120lbs×10 last week, try 130lbs×10 or 120lbs×12. Focus: Lat engagement (feel mid-back working), full ROM, squeeze at contraction. Purpose: Back width, vertical pulling strength, lats and upper back development.

sections.title: Superset 2
sections.overview: Front Squat or Goblet Squat + Dumbbell Bench Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Front Squat OR Goblet Squat

intensity.description: If you've transitioned to front squat, continue adding weight. If still goblet, heavier dumbbell or more reps. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent, brief pause, explosive up
exercises.notes: Front Squat (if using barbell): Bar on front delts, elbows high (clean grip or cross-arm), chest up. Descend to parallel or below (stay upright—don't let torso collapse forward), drive up explosively. Week 6 progression: If Week 5 you front squatted 115lbs×12, try 125lbs×12 or 115lbs×15. Goblet Squat (if still using dumbbell): Hold dumbbell vertically at chest, descend to parallel or below, drive up explosively. Week 6 progression: If Week 5 you used 60lb dumbbell×12, try 65lb×12 or 60lb×15. Choose based on progression: If you've been doing goblet and hitting 12+ reps easily with heaviest available dumbbell, consider transitioning to barbell front squat. If goblet still feels appropriate, push for upper end of rep range (15 reps). Focus: Depth, upright torso, quad engagement. Purpose: Quad-dominant squat pattern, lower body strength.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press

intensity.description: If Week 5 you used 60lb dumbbells×10, try 65lb×10 or 60lb×12. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent to chest level
exercises.notes: Setup: Lie on flat bench, feet on floor, dumbbells held at chest level. Execution: Press dumbbells up and slightly together at top (don't bang them), lower with control to chest level (elbows ~45-degree angle). Don't bounce at bottom. Week 6 progression: If Week 5 you pressed 60lb dumbbells×10, try 65lb×10 (5lb jump per side) or 60lb×12. If 65lb feels too heavy for 8 reps, stick with 60lb and push for 12 reps. Dumbbells increase in 5lb increments, so progression can be challenging—adding reps is equally valid. Focus: Full ROM, stable shoulder position, controlled eccentric. Purpose: Chest/shoulder/tricep strength, horizontal pressing pattern.

sections.title: Superset 3
sections.overview: Dumbbell RDL + Dumbbell Curls (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)

intensity.description: Final progressive overload session for RDLs before Week 7's peak test. Push for max reps or slightly heavier dumbbells. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent (feel hamstring stretch), controlled return
exercises.notes: Setup: Hold dumbbells at sides, feet hip-width, knees slightly bent. Execution: Hinge at hips (push hips back), feel hamstring stretch as dumbbells travel to mid-shin, squeeze glutes to return. Maintain neutral spine—don't round lower back. Week 6 progression: If Week 5 you used 45lb dumbbells×12, try 50lb×12 or 45lb×15. This is your final progressive overload RDL session before Week 7's peak test. Push for upper end of rep range (12 reps) or heavier dumbbells. Focus: Hamstring eccentric stretch (this is where growth happens), glute contraction at top. Don't rush—2-3sec descent to feel full hamstring stretch. Purpose: Posterior chain strength, hip hinge pattern, hamstring development.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Curls (Standing)

intensity.description: Final progressive overload session for curls before Week 7. Strict form—no swinging. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled curl (1-2sec), squeeze biceps at top for 1sec, controlled descent (2-3sec)
exercises.notes: Setup: Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms forward (supinated grip). Execution: Curl dumbbells to shoulder height (don't swing or use momentum), squeeze biceps at top for 1sec (emphasize contraction), control descent to full elbow extension (2-3sec eccentric). Keep elbows pinned to sides—don't let them drift forward. Week 6 progression: If Week 5 you used 30lb dumbbells×12, try 35lb×12 or 30lb×15. This is your final progressive overload curl session before Week 7's peak test. Curls respond well to volume and time under tension—if weight jump feels too big, add reps and slow down eccentric (2-3sec descent). Focus: Bicep contraction, strict form. No body English—if you need to swing, weight is too heavy. Purpose: Bicep strength, elbow flexion pattern, arm development.

sections.title: Optional Cardio Finisher
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy (5min)

exercises.name: Burpees

intensity.description: Total ~5min. Skip if fatigued—main supersets are priority.

exercises.notes: 10 burpees (chest to ground, jump to stand with hands overhead), rest 30sec. Repeat 5 times. Purpose: Full-body conditioning, metabolic conditioning. Week 6 context: You've been doing progressive overload for 6 weeks—you're likely feeling accumulated fatigue. Cardio finisher is optional and should be skipped if you're feeling run-down. Week 7 is peak test week (75-80% loads, RPE 8-9), so prioritize being fresh for that over adding cardio fatigue now. Only do finisher if you have energy left and want the conditioning work. Don't feel guilty about skipping—the main 3 supersets are what matters.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Light stretching (5min)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Focus areas: hamstrings (standing or seated—extra focus after RDLs and deadlifts), glutes (figure-4 stretch or pigeon pose), lower back (cat-cow or child's pose), lats (overhead and side stretches—extra focus after pull-ups/pulldowns), biceps. Hold each stretch 20-30sec. Breathe deeply. You've deadlifted twice this week (Mon + Wed)—lower back and hamstrings need recovery attention. Purpose: Aid recovery, reduce muscle tension, prepare for Friday's final progressive overload session.

title: Full Body C: Lower Emphasis
description: Week 6, Day 5—Final progressive overload session before Week 7's peak test. This is the last time you'll squat at RPE 7-8 before Week 7's RPE 8-9 test. Visualize success before each set. Add 5-10lbs or aim for 2 more reps than Week 5. Week 6 complete after this session—compare loads to Week 3 and Week 5. Session time: 35-40min.

quote.text: This is the last time you'll squat at RPE 7-8 before Week 7's RPE 8-9 test—visualize success before each set.
quote.author: Week 6 Final Session Philosophy

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Same routine—final push (5-10min)

exercises.name: Light Cardio (Bike, Row, or Jog)

intensity.description: Until you break a light sweat

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature

exercises.name: Dynamic Stretching
exercises.notes: Leg swings, hip circles, ankle mobility (wall drives), bodyweight squats (extra reps—prepare for heavy squats), walking lunges (10 steps—practice for Superset 3), light bar work (empty bar squats and RDLs). This is your final progressive overload warm-up—take it seriously. Week 7 will be heavier (75-80%), Week 8 is deload. Make this session count.

sections.title: Superset 1
sections.overview: Front Squat or Barbell Back Squat + Dumbbell Bench Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Front Squat OR Barbell Back Squat

intensity.description: If Monday you did back squat, consider front squat here for variation. If you've been alternating, continue. Add 5-10lbs or aim for 2 more reps than Week 5. Visualize success. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent, brief pause, explosive up
exercises.notes: Front Squat: Bar on front delts, elbows high (clean grip or cross-arm). Descend to parallel or below (stay upright—don't let torso collapse forward), drive up explosively. Barbell Back Squat (if choosing): Same setup as Monday. Consider variation: if Monday was high-bar (bar on traps), try low-bar (bar on rear delts) today, or vice versa. Week 6 final session progression: If Week 5 you front squatted 125lbs×10, try 135lbs×10 or 125lbs×12. This is the last time you'll squat at RPE 7-8 before Week 7's RPE 8-9 test. Visualize success before each set: see yourself completing all reps with good form, bar speed fast, hitting depth. Mental preparation matters—Week 7 you'll test 75-80% loads. Focus: Depth, upright torso, quad engagement, bar speed. Purpose: Quad-dominant squat pattern, lower body strength, mental preparation for Week 7 peak test.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press

intensity.description: Third bench press session this week (Mon, Wed, Fri). Loads may be slightly lighter due to accumulated fatigue—that's fine. Focus on control and full ROM. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Same setup and execution as Monday and Wednesday. Press dumbbells up and slightly together, control descent to chest level. Focus: This is your third bench press session in 5 days. Chest volume is accumulating—you may feel slightly fatigued, and that's normal and expected. Don't chase Monday's or Wednesday's numbers if you're tired—focus on quality reps and hitting RPE 7-8 with good form. Week 6 context: Compare to Week 5 Day 5 (not Monday or Wednesday). If Week 5 you pressed 60lb dumbbells×10, try 65lb×10 or 60lb×12 today. Purpose: Chest/shoulder/tricep strength, volume accumulation across 3 sessions, final progressive overload before Week 7.

sections.title: Superset 2
sections.overview: Barbell RDL + Barbell Row or Dumbbell Row (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)

intensity.description: If Week 5 you did 135lbs×12, try 145lbs×12 or 135lbs×15. Final progressive overload RDL session before Week 7. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: 2-3 sec descent (feel hamstring stretch), explosive glute contraction to return
exercises.notes: Setup: Barbell starts in deadlift position (on floor) or on rack at hip height. Feet hip-width, overhand grip just outside legs. Execution: Hinge at hips (push hips back), bar travels down shins to mid-shin (feel hamstring stretch), squeeze glutes to return to standing. Knees stay slightly bent throughout. Don't round lower back—maintain neutral spine. Week 6 final session progression: If Week 5 you did 135lbs×12, try 145lbs×12 or 135lbs×15. This is your final progressive overload RDL before Week 7's peak test. Push for upper end of rep range or add 10lbs. Focus: Hamstring eccentric stretch (2-3sec descent), glute contraction at top (lockout with glutes, not back). Barbell RDL allows heavier loads than dumbbell RDL—if Wednesday you used 50lb dumbbells (100lbs total), today you might use 145-165lbs on barbell. Purpose: Posterior chain strength, hip hinge pattern with heavier loads.

exercises.name: Barbell Row OR Dumbbell Row (Bent-Over, Both Arms)

intensity.description: Pull to sternum, squeeze shoulder blades, control descent. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled pull, squeeze at top for 1-2sec, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Barbell Row: Hinge at hips (similar to RDL position but holding barbell). Torso ~45-degree angle to floor. Pull barbell to sternum (underhand or overhand grip—overhand targets mid-back more, underhand targets lats more), squeeze shoulder blades together at top for 1-2sec, control descent. Don't let torso rise—maintain hinge position. Dumbbell Row (bent-over, both arms): Same bent-over position. Row dumbbells to hips (pull elbows back, not out to sides), squeeze shoulder blades together at top for 1-2sec, control descent. Don't let torso rotate—keep shoulders square. Week 6 progression: If Week 5 you rowed 95lbs barbell×12, try 105lbs×12 or 95lbs×15. Focus: Mid-back and lat contraction, squeeze at top. Purpose: Back thickness, bilateral pulling strength, core stability (no bench support).

sections.title: Superset 3
sections.overview: Walking Lunges + Dumbbell Overhead Press (3 sets, 60-90sec rest)

exercises.name: Walking Lunges

intensity.description: Heavier dumbbells than Week 5. If you used 30lb dumbbells, try 35lb. 12 steps per leg—your legs should be burning by the end. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Controlled descent, explosive drive through front heel to next step
exercises.notes: Setup: Hold dumbbells at sides (not overhead). Stand upright. Execution: Step forward into lunge (front thigh parallel to ground, back knee nearly touches floor), push through front heel to step forward into next lunge (don't step back—walk forward continuously). 12 steps per leg = 24 total steps per set. You'll need ~30-40 feet of space. Week 6 final session progression: If Week 5 you used 30lb dumbbells×10/leg, try 35lb×10/leg or 30lb×12/leg today. Push for 12 steps per leg this week (upper end of range). Focus: Front knee tracks over toes (don't cave inward), torso upright, balance and control. If you wobble significantly, use lighter weight—form is priority. Your legs should be burning by the end—that's the goal. Purpose: Unilateral leg strength, quad/glute emphasis, balance and stability, final lower body volume before Week 7.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Overhead Press

intensity.description: Third overhead press session this week (Mon, Wed, Fri). Final progressive overload session before Week 7. Standing or seated. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve.

exercises.tempo: Explosive press, controlled descent
exercises.notes: Same setup and execution as Monday and Wednesday. Press dumbbells overhead to full lockout, control descent to shoulder level. Don't hyperextend back. Focus: This is your third overhead press session in 5 days. Shoulders are accumulating volume—you may feel slightly fatigued. That's normal and expected. Don't chase Monday's or Wednesday's numbers if you're tired—hit RPE 7-8 with good form. Week 6 final session: Compare to Week 5 Day 5 (not Mon or Wed). If Week 5 you pressed 40lb dumbbells×10, try 45lb×10 or 40lb×12 today. Purpose: Shoulder strength, overhead pressing pattern, volume accumulation, final progressive overload before Week 7 peak test.

sections.title: Optional Cardio Finisher
sections.overview: Only add if you have time and energy (10min)

exercises.name: Farmer Carries

intensity.value: Very heavy dumbbells or kettlebells—challenging to hold but you can walk without stopping
intensity.description: Total ~10min. Skip if fatigued—Week 6 complete after main supersets.

exercises.notes: Pick weight that's challenging to hold (e.g., 70-90lb dumbbells or kettlebells per hand if strong, 50-60lb if less experienced). Walk 50 yards with good posture (chest up, shoulders back, core tight), set weights down, rest 2min. Repeat 4 times. Purpose: Grip strength, core stability, full-body strength endurance. Week 6 context: This is the final progressive overload finisher. You've accumulated 6 weeks of training stress—you're likely feeling fatigued. Skip finisher if you're run-down. Week 7 is peak test week (75-80% loads, RPE 8-9)—prioritize being fresh for that. Week 8 is deload (40% volume reduction, no finishers). Only do finisher if you have time and energy. Don't feel guilty about skipping—Week 6 is complete after main 3 supersets.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Extra focus on legs—Week 6 complete (5min)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Focus areas: quads (standing quad stretch or couch stretch—extra focus after lunges and squats), hamstrings (standing or seated—extra focus after RDLs), glutes (figure-4 or pigeon pose), hip flexors (kneeling lunge stretch), calves, shoulders. Hold each stretch 20-30sec. Breathe deeply. Week 6 is complete after this session—you've accumulated 4 weeks of progressive overload (Weeks 3-6). Loads have increased 10-20%, work capacity has improved significantly, cardiovascular fitness is noticeably better. Stretching now aids recovery and prepares for Week 7's peak test. Purpose: Aid recovery, reduce muscle tension, improve flexibility. Week 6 reflection: Compare loads to Week 5 and Week 3—did you successfully add 5-10lbs or 1-2 reps across most exercises? Calculate percentage increase from Week 3 to Week 6. Typical progression: 10-20% increase in 4 weeks. If you're in that range, you're on track for Week 7's peak test.
